Detailed Description

template<bool t_bManaged>
class WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >

???.

This class encapsulates a Windows graphics device interface (GDI) region. A region is an elliptical or polygonal area within a window. To use regions, you use the methods of class CRgnT with the clipping methods defined as members of class CDCT.

The methods of CRgnT create, alter, and retrieve information about the region object for which they are called.

Definition at line 687 of file atlgdi.h.

Constructor.

This constructor creates an instance of a CRgnT object.

Parameters:
hRgn  A region to initialize the object with. Can be NULL.

Destructor.

If the type if CRgn, then the region is destroyed. If the type if CRgnHandle, then nothing is done.

Definition at line 709 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::m_hRgn.

template<bool t_bManaged>
int WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::CombineRgn (  HRGN    hRgnSrc,
int    nCombineMode
)  [inline]
 

Combines two regions.

This method creates a new GDI region by combining two existing regions. The regions are combined as specified by nCombineMode.

The two specified regions are combined, and the resulting region handle is stored in the CRgnT object. Therefore, whatever region is stored in the CRgnT object is replaced by the combined region.

Parameters:
hRgnSrc  Identifies an existing region.
nCombineMode  Specifies the operation to be performed when combining the two source regions.
Returns:
Specifies the type of the resulting region.

Definition at line 808 of file atlgdi.h.

int WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::CombineRgn (  HRGN    hRgnSrc1,
HRGN    hRgnSrc2,
int    nCombineMode
)  [inline]
 

Combines two regions.

This method creates a new GDI region by combining two existing regions. The regions are combined as specified by nCombineMode.

The two specified regions are combined, and the resulting region handle is stored in the CRgnT object. Therefore, whatever region is stored in the CRgnT object is replaced by the combined region.

Parameters:
hRgnSrc1  Identifies an existing region.
hRgnSrc2  Identifies an existing region.
nCombineMode  Specifies the operation to be performed when combining the two source regions.
Returns:
Specifies the type of the resulting region.

Definition at line 803 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::m_hRgn.

template<bool t_bManaged>
int WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::CopyRgn (  HRGN    hRgnSrc )  [inline]
 

Copies a region.

This method copies the region defined by pRgnSrc into the CRgnT object. The new region replaces the region formerly stored in the CRgnT object. This function is a special case of the CombineRgn method.

Parameters:
hRgnSrc  Identifies an existing region.
Returns:
Specifies the type of the resulting region.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HRGN WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::CreateEllipticRgn (  int    x1,
int    y1,
int    x2,
int    y2
)  [inline]
 

Creates a region.

This method creates a elliptic region that is stored in the CRgnT object.

Parameters:
x1  Specifies the logical x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the ellipse.
y1  Specifies the logical y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the ellipse.
x2  Specifies the logical x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the ellipse.
y2  Specifies the logical y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the ellipse.
Returns:
The new region handle.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HRGN WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::CreateFromData (  const XFORM *    lpXForm,
int    nCount,
const RGNDATA *    pRgnData
)  [inline]
 

Creates a region.

Creates a region from XFORM data.

Parameters:
lpXForm  Pointer to an XFORM structure that defines the transformation to be performed on the region. If this pointer is NULL, the identity transformation is used.
nCount  Specifies the number of bytes pointed to by lpRgnData.
pRgnData  Pointer to a RGNDATA structure that contains the region data in logical units.
Returns:
The new region handle.

int    nCount,
int    nMode
)  [inline]
 

Creates a region.

Creates a region from a series of points.

Parameters:
lpPoints  Pointer to an array of points.
nCount  Number of points in array.
nMode  Specifies the fill mode used to determine which pixels are in the region.
Returns:
The new region handle.

Definition at line 751 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::m_hRgn.

template<bool t_bManaged>
HRGN WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::CreatePolyPolygonRgn (  LPPOINT    lpPoints,
LPINT    lpPolyCounts,
int    nCount,
int    nPolyFillMode
)  [inline]
 

Creates a region.

The CreatePolyPolygonRgn function creates a region consisting of a series of polygons. The polygons can overlap.

Parameters:
lpPoints  Pointer to an array of POINT structures that define the vertices of the polygons in logical units. The polygons are specified consecutively. Each polygon is presumed closed and each vertex is specified only once.
lpPolyCounts  Pointer to an array of integers, each of which specifies the number of points in one of the polygons in the array pointed to by lpPoints.
nCount  Specifies the total number of integers in the array pointed to by lpPolyCounts.
nPolyFillMode  Specifies the fill mode used to determine which pixels are in the region.
Returns:
The new region handle.

Creates a region.

This method creates a rectangular region that is stored in the CRgnT object.

y1  Specifies the logical y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region.
x2  Specifies the logical x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the region.
y2  Specifies the logical y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the region.
Returns:
The new region handle.

HRGN WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::CreateRoundRectRgn (  int    x1,
int    y1,
int    x2,
int    y2,
int    x3,
int    y3
)  [inline]
 

Creates a region.

The CreateRoundRectRgn function creates a rectangular region with rounded corners.

Parameters:
x1  Specifies the logical x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region.
y1  Specifies the logical y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the region.
x2  Specifies the logical x-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the region.
y2  Specifies the logical y-coordinate of the lower-right corner of the region.
x3  Specifies the width of the ellipse used to create the rounded corners in logical units.
y3  Specifies the height of the ellipse used to create the rounded corners in logical units.
Returns:
The new region handle.

Definition at line 818 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::m_hRgn.

template<bool t_bManaged>
int WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::GetRegionData (  LPRGNDATA    lpRgnData,
int    nDataSize
)  const [inline]
 

Retrieves information about the region.

This method fills the specified buffer with data describing the region. The data includes the dimensions of the rectangles that make up the region. This method is used in conjunction with the CreateFromData method.

Parameters:
lpRgnData  Points to a RGNDATA data structure that receives the information. If this parameter is NULL, the return value contains the number of bytes needed for the region data.
nDataSize  Specifies the size, in bytes, of the lpRgnData buffer.
Returns:
If the function succeeds and nCount specifies an adequate number of bytes, the return value is always nCount. If the function fails, or if nCount specifies less than adequate number of bytes, the return value is zero (error).

Definition at line 724 of file atlgdi.h.

References WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::m_hRgn.

template<bool t_bManaged>
int WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::OffsetRgn (  POINT    point )  [inline]
 

Offsets the region.

This method moves the region stored in the CRgnT object by the specified offsets. The method moves the region x units along the x-axis and y units along the y-axis.

Parameters:
point  The x-coordinate of point specifies the number of units to move left or right. The y-coordinate of point specifies the number of units to move up or down. The point parameter may be either a POINT structure or a CPoint object.
Returns:
The type of the new region.

)  [inline]
 

Offsets the region.

This method moves the region stored in the CRgnT object by the specified offsets. The method moves the region x units along the x-axis and y units along the y-axis.

Parameters:
x  Specifies the number of units to move left or right.
y  Specifies the number of units to move up or down.
Returns:
The type of the new region.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::PtInRegion (  POINT    point )  const [inline]
 

Tests if a point lies within the region.

This method checks whether the point specified by x and y is in the region stored within the CRgnT object.

Parameters:
point  The x- and y-coordinates of point specify the x- and y-coordinates of the point to test the value of. The point parameter can either be a POINT structure or a CPoint object.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<bool t_bManaged>
BOOL WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::RectInRegion (  LPCRECT    lpRect )  const [inline]
 

Tests if a rectangle lies within the region.

This method determines whether any part of the rectangle specified by lpRect is within the boundaries of the region stored in the CRgnT object.

Parameters:
lpRect  Points to a RECT or CRect that contains a rectangle.
Returns:
Nonzero if successful; otherwise, it is zero.

template<bool t_bManaged>
void WTL::CRgnT< t_bManaged >::SetRectRgn (  LPCRECT    lpRect )  [inline]
 

Sets the region shape.

This method creates a rectangular region. The CRgnT object must already have been initialized with a valid Windows region before calling SetRectRgn.

Parameters:
lpRect  Points to a RECT or CRect that contains a rectangle.
